stories.title: Melody – a language that compiles to regular expressions

stories.text:
Otomi (open source) offers an admin to delegate the following self-service features:

- Configure resource quota - Configure egress - Configure ingress network policies - Configure egress filtering - Download the KUBECFG - Change OIDC settings - Configure alert receivers

The self-service features are all offered through a web UI.

Delegation of control is part of the multi-tenancy option in Otomi. Create teams and provide secure access to their team space and shared tools like Harbor and Vault, container logs, Grafana dashboards, and Otomi self-service features.

Teams can use the web UI to deploy workloads, configure ingress, configure network policies, create secrets and create jobs/cronjobs (even without the need to have direct API/kubectl access).

To learn more about Otomi, check out the GitHub repo https://github.com/redkubes/otomi-core or https://otomi.io
stories.title: How do you as a Kubernetes platform admin delegate control to development teams?

stories.text:
A simple app I built since I was using random.org a lot to pick an option out of a list. There's also a flip a coin option as well as an option to input a list of options and get one extracted similar to a raffle

Feedback is greatly appreciated
stories.title: Show HN: Simple App that picks an option out of a list
